thread.title: Man still in critical condition after Staten Island bus stab
thread.title_full: Man still in critical condition after Staten Island bus stab - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Man still in critical condition after Staten Island bus stab
text:
MIRA WASSEF/Staten Island Advance Mmonbadoe Zeahwon remained in critical condition Wednesday at Richmond University Medical Center, a spokesman there said, a day after he was stabbed five times in the chest and hand in a fight on a Staten Island bus. The man who was stabbed on a Staten Island bus in a fight over a seat was struggling to stay alive Wednesday.
Mmonbadoe Zeahwon remained in critical condition at Richmond University Medical Center, a spokesman there said, a day after he was stabbed five times in the chest and hand after the argument turned violent.
Zeahwon, 24, was attacked aroud 1:40 p.m. Tuesday when the S74 was at a stop on Canal St. near Water St. in the Stapleton section, officials said.
CHECK OUT OUR NEW APP: GET THE DAILY NEWS ON ANDROID OR IOS
The victim got into an argument in the rear of the bus with a woman over who should get the seat.
MIRA WASSEF/Staten Island Advance Police investigate after a 24-year-old man was stabbed on a bus in Stapleton in Staten Island Tuesday. When the woman went to slap Zeahwon, he raised his hand to block the blow, cops said.
That's when a man who was with the woman suddenly pulled a knife and stabbed Zeahwon â€” and then fled, they said.
No one else was injured, according to MTA spokesman Kevin Ortiz.
It was not immediately clear how many people were on the bus when the knifing occurred. And Ortiz said the vehicle was not equipped with a camera.
drivoli@nydailynews.com
